channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Knife crimes recorded in Wales double in a decade
item.description: Home Office statistics show there were 1,461 offences in 2020-21, up from 700 ten years ago.

item.title: WW2 Normandy veteran's son 'insulted' by pension repayment demand
item.description: David Edwards' son Chris says his father had missed out on £100,000 he was entitled to.

item.title: Fuel shortage: Several petrol stations shut in Wales
item.description: But Tesco and Asda say they have good availability and can refill despite queues at some stations.

item.title: Carmarthenshire: Boy, 3, hit by trailer while on bike, inquest hears
item.description: Ianto Cerwyn Sior Jenkins, three, had been playing with his sister and cousin.

item.title: Eight-storey UK flag for Cardiff scrapped over £180k price tag
item.description: The plans "did not represent good value for the taxpayer", the UK government says.

item.title: Covid: Welsh government spent £32k on GLC vaccine campaign
item.description: Goldie Lookin' Chain were paid for the Get the Jab Done single, urging people to get the Covid jab.

item.title: Covid-19 in Wales: A third of positive cases are unvaccinated
item.description: A third of Covid cases are among the unvaccinated, new Public Health Wales figures show.

item.title: Hafodyrynys crash: Woman killed and two-year-old hurt
item.description: A 75-year-old woman was killed and a two-year-old girl was among five people hurt, police say.

item.title: Paramedics tried to save Clydach baby in lake, inquest told
item.description: Eighteen-month-old Finlay Howell Sanders was found in a lake in the grounds of a manor house.

item.title: Anthony Hampton not guilty of six child sex charges
item.description: Former teacher Anthony Hampton denied abusing four children between the 1970s and 1990s.

item.title: Llwynypia house fire: Woman dies of injuries after rescue
item.description: Police arrested a 26-year-old man but later released him, saying the fire was not the result of arson.

item.title: Covid: Man charged to rearrange speeding course reimbursed
item.description: A man who was charged to rearrange his speeding course due to catching Covid receives a refund.

item.title: Carmarthenshire teen's life 'on hold' after developing Tourette's syndrome
item.description: Megan Jones, 17, began getting head jerks in February, which have progressed to seizures.

item.title: Carmarthenshire dog rescue: Charity takes in 47 puppies
item.description: One charity has taken in almost 50 puppies who had been living in "horrendous" conditions.

item.title: Disabled boxing classes 'changes lives'
item.description: A veteran who was injured in service now teaches people with disabilities how to box.

item.title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK: Meet Cardiff's Victoria Scone
item.description: She is the first female act to appear on RuPaul's Drag Race UK.

item.title: 'I have stage four cancer but avoided chemotherapy'
item.description: Kate Molton has stage four lung cancer - but will not need chemotherapy.

item.title: Wales' ambulance crews struggle with 'worst-ever' crisis
item.description: An ambulance worker says morale is low as hospitals struggle to cope with patient numbers.

item.title: United Rugby Championship: Cardiff Rugby 33-21 Connacht
item.description: Cardiff Rugby overcome losing two injured Wales fly-halves to secure victory in the opening United Rugby Championship match against Connacht.

item.title: Wales v New Zealand: Wayne Pivac faces fly-half concerns to face All Blacks
item.description: Wales head coach Wayne Pivac faces a fly-half injury conundrum ahead of the New Zealand game on 30 October after injuries to Cardiff fly-halves Rhys Priestland and Jarrod Evans.

item.title: George North: Wales and Ospreys star eyes festive return
item.description: Versatile Wales and Ospreys back George North hopes to return from a serious knee injury during the festive period this season.

item.title: Barrow 2-1 Newport County: Second-half goals earn Bluebirds victory
item.description: Second-half goals from Josh Kay and Josh Gordon see Barrow come from behind to beat Newport County at Holker Street.

item.title: Rhys Williams: Swansea defender has found week 'tough' after alleged racial abuse
item.description: Rhys Williams has come through a "really tough" week in the wake of alleged racial abuse directed towards him, says Swansea City boss Russell Martin.

item.title: 'Fe gafodd fy mrawd ei drywanu - rhaid gweithredu'
item.description: Rhybuddio y gallai troseddau cysylltiedig â chyllyll godi eto yn sgil llacio cyfyngiadau.

item.title: Bachgen 3 oed fu farw wedi'i daro gan gerbyd â threlar
item.description: Cwest yn clywed y bu farw Ianto Jenkins, 3, ar ôl cael ei daro gan gerbyd ar eu fferm ger Efailwen.

item.title: Atal cynllun £180,000 am Jac yr Undeb yng Nghaerdydd
item.description: Llywodraeth y DU wedi penderfynu yn erbyn y cynllun i osod baner 32m o uchder yn y brifddinas.

item.title: Sut i arddio yn yr hydref
item.description: Meinir Gwilym sy'n rhoi cyngor ar beth i'w blannu yn yr ardd mis yma

item.title: Canlyniadau trydedd rownd Cwpan Cymru
item.description: Holl ganlyniadau'r penwythnos wrth i 32 o dimau gystadlu yn nhrydedd rownd Cwpan Cymru.
